snippet: At least 25 people, mostly civilians, were killed in the northeastern province of Raqqa as government forces attacked territory controlled by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.
abstract: At least 25 people, mostly civilians, are killed in northeastern Syrian province of Raqqa as government forces attack territory controlled by extremist Sunni militant group Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Raqqa, Syria.

lead_paragraph: At least 25 people, mostly civilians, were killed in the northeastern province of Raqqa as government forces attacked territory controlled by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
